item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 29, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL 17.4 (129 points | 39 comments)
2. Chain of Recursive Thoughts: Make AI think harder by making it argue with itself (280 points | 133 comments)
3. Bamba: An open-source LLM that crosses a transformer with an SSM (101 points | 30 comments)
4. Everything we announced at our first LlamaCon (108 points | 57 comments)

8. Modern Realty (YC S24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
9. I use zip bombs to protect my server (186 points | 106 comments)
10. It's School time: Adventures in hacking an old Kindle (42 points | 5 comments)
11. ArkFlow: High-performance Rust stream processing engine (122 points | 26 comments)
12. O3 beats a master-level GeoGuessr player, even with fake EXIF data (342 points | 235 comments)
13. Performance optimization is hard because it's fundamentally a brute-force task (194 points | 89 comments)
14. Firefox tab groups are here (415 points | 272 comments)
15. The last masters of Afro-Colombian machete fencing (27 points | 5 comments)
16. Programming languages should have a tree traversal primitive (148 points | 122 comments)

19. Indian court orders blocking of Proton Mail (240 points | 102 comments)
20. The missteps that led to a fatal plane crash at Reagan National Airport (39 points | 30 comments)
21. Show HN: A Chrome extension that will auto-reject non-essential cookies (182 points | 120 comments)
22. Show HN: AgenticSeek – Self-hosted alternative to cloud-based AI tools (47 points | 6 comments)
23. Show HN: Flowcode – Turing-complete visual programming platform (151 points | 66 comments)
24. LibreLingo – FOSS Alternative to Duolingo (651 points | 301 comments)
25. A single line of code cost $8000 (267 points | 339 comments)
26. Beyond Performance: Measuring the environmental impact of analytical databases (15 points | 2 comments)
27. Gaussian Splatting Meets ROS2 (49 points | 12 comments)
28. AirBorne: Wormable zero-click remote code execution (RCE) in AirPlay protocol (35 points | 5 comments)
29. Try Switching to Kagi (536 points | 371 comments)
30. What happens at the end of 'Trading Places'? (2013) (57 points | 16 comments)
